content:
TITLE: Downloading a Video by ID or URL
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to download a Twitch video using either its ID or full URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download 221837124
twitch-dl download https://www.twitch.tv/videos/221837124
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Twitch Video by URL
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch video using its full URL
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1418494769
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic twitch-dl Download Command Usage
DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic command format for using the download functionality in twitch-dl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download [OPTIONS] [IDS]...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Twitch Clip by URL
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch clip using its full URL
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download https://www.twitch.tv/bananasaurus_rex/clip/PlacidColdClipsdadDeIlluminati-hL2s_aLE4CHvVN4J
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Videos from a Twitch Channel
DESCRIPTION: Command to list all available videos from a specific Twitch channel. This is used to find videos before downloading them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Video Quality for Download
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a particular quality (720p) when downloading a video to avoid the quality selection prompt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download -q 720p 221837124
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading a Twitch Clip by URL
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch clip by providing its full URL. This allows downloading short clips created from longer streams.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download https://www.twitch.tv/bananasaurus_rex/clip/PlacidColdClipsdadDeIlluminati-hL2s_aLE4CHvVN4J
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Multiple Videos
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to download multiple videos in sequence by specifying multiple video IDs, with the source quality option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download 1559928295 1557034274 1555157293 -q source
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading a Twitch Video by ID
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch video by providing only its numerical ID. This is a more concise alternative to using the full URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download 1418494769
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Twitch Clip by Slug
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch clip using just its slug identifier
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download PlacidColdClipsdadDeIlluminati-hL2s_aLE4CHvVN4J
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Highest Quality Video
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to download a video at the best available quality by using the 'source' quality option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download -q source 221837124
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading a Twitch Clip by Slug
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch clip by providing only its slug (unique identifier). This is a more concise alternative to using the full clip URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download PlacidColdClipsdadDeIlluminati-hL2s_aLE4CHvVN4J
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Twitch Video by ID
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch video using just its ID number
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download 1418494769
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: JSON Format Video Listing
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves all channel videos and outputs them in JSON format for scripting purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex --json --all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading a Twitch Video by URL
DESCRIPTION: Command to download a Twitch video by providing its full URL. This is the most user-friendly way to download a specific video.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1418494769
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default Download Quality in twitch-dl using Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the default quality parameter to 'source' for the download command in twitch-dl using an environment variable. This eliminates the need to specify '--quality source' with each command invocation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/environment_variables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
TWITCH_DL_DOWNLOAD_QUALITY="source"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rendering Twitch chat using twitch-dl
DESCRIPTION: Example of rendering Twitch chat for a video with specific width, height, and dark mode settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/chat.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
twitch-dl chat --dark --width 500 --height 1080 2237172069 -o chat.mp4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Audio Only
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to download only the audio track of a video using the 'audio_only' quality option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/download.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download -q audio_only 221837124
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Help Information for twitch-dl CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to view the list of available commands for the twitch-dl tool using the --help flag. This command provides an overview of all available functionalities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Clips Listing Command
DESCRIPTION: Basic command to list top 10 clips of all time for a channel
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using twitch-dl info Command - Basic Syntax
DESCRIPTION: The basic syntax for using the twitch-dl info command to retrieve information about Twitch content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/info.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl info [OPTIONS] ID
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Video Information with twitch-dl
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to get information about a Twitch video using its ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/info.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl info 863849735
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Clips with Custom Limit
DESCRIPTION: Command to list a specific number of clips using the --limit option
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --limit 50
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Clip Information with twitch-dl
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to get information about a Twitch clip using its slug.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/info.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl info BusyBlushingCattleItsBoshyTime
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Weekly Clips
DESCRIPTION: Command to download all clips from the past week, skipping existing files
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --download --period last_week
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Clips with Pager
DESCRIPTION: Command to list clips with pagination enabled, showing 10 clips at a time
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --pager
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Twitch Channel Clips
DESCRIPTION: Command to list all available clips from a specified Twitch channel
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Clips from a Twitch Channel
DESCRIPTION: Command to list all available clips from a specific Twitch channel. This is used to identify clips before downloading them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing All Channel Clips
DESCRIPTION: Command to fetch all available clips for a channel using the --all flag
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Twitch Channel Videos
DESCRIPTION: Command to list all available videos from a specified Twitch channel
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Video Listing Command
DESCRIPTION: Lists recent videos from a specified Twitch channel, defaulting to 10 videos.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing All Channel Videos
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves all videos from a channel without pagination limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex --all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Usage of twitch-dl chat command
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic usage syntax for the twitch-dl chat command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/chat.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
twitch-dl chat [OPTIONS] ID
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Combining video and chat using ffmpeg
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use ffmpeg to combine the downloaded video and rendered chat into a single output file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/chat.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
ffmpeg -i video.mp4 -i chat.mp4 -filter_complex hstack=inputs=2 chat_with_video.mp4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Authentication Token with twitch-dl Commands
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to pass an authentication token to twitch-dl's info and download commands. The auth token allows access to subscriber-only content using your Twitch account credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/authentication.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl info 221837124 --auth-token iduetx4i107rn4b9wrgctf590aiktv
twitch-dl download 221837124 --auth-token iduetx4i107rn4b9wrgctf590aiktv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the twitch-dl cache command with CLI options
DESCRIPTION: This command allows users to manage the cache in twitch-dl. Users can view the current cache state or clear specific cache types using the -c/--clear flag with values like 'all', 'fonts', 'chats', 'videos', 'emotes', or 'badges'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/cache.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl cache [OPTIONS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Output of twitch-dl env on Linux
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example output of the 'twitch-dl env' command when run on a Linux system. It displays the twitch-dl version, Linux platform details, and Python version information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/env.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
twitch-dl 1.21.0
Platform: Linux-5.10.0-10-amd64-x86_64-with-glibc2.31
Python 3.9.2 (default, Feb 28 2021, 17:03:44) [GCC 10.2.1 20210110]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading twitch-dl Using pipx in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command upgrades twitch-dl to the latest version using pipx.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pipx upgrade twitch-dl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing twitch-dl Using pipx in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command installs twitch-dl using pipx, which creates an isolated environment for the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pipx install twitch-dl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing twitch-dl with Chat Rendering Dependencies in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command installs twitch-dl with additional dependencies for chat rendering functionality using pipx.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pipx install "twitch-dl[chat]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing twitch-dl with chat dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install twitch-dl with the optional chat dependencies using pipx.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/chat.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
pipx install "twitch-dl[chat]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking twitch-dl Version in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command verifies the installation of twitch-dl by displaying its version information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl --version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Clips by Time Period
DESCRIPTION: Command to list clips from a specific time period using the --period option
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --period past_week
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Clips in JSON Format
DESCRIPTION: Command to output clips data in JSON format for scripting purposes
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/clips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl clips bananasaurus_rex --json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Videos by Game
DESCRIPTION: Lists videos filtered by specific games, supporting multiple game filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos --game "doom eternal" --game "cave story" bananasaurus_rex
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Paginated Video Listing
DESCRIPTION: Lists channel videos with default pagination of 10 items per page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex --pager
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom Page Size Video Listing
DESCRIPTION: Lists channel videos with custom pagination size of 5 items per page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/videos.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl videos bananasaurus_rex --pager 5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Outputting Information in JSON Format
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to get Twitch clip information in JSON format using the --json option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/info.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl info BusyBlushingCattleItsBoshyTime --json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Command-Specific Help in twitch-dl CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access detailed help information for a specific command in twitch-dl. This includes a description of the command and all its available arguments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl <command> --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Twitch video using twitch-dl
DESCRIPTION: Example of downloading a Twitch video in 1080p quality using the twitch-dl download command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/chat.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
twitch-dl download -q 1080p 2237172069 -o video.mp4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using twitch-dl env Command in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the 'twitch-dl env' command. It prints environment information for inclusion in bug reports, including the twitch-dl version, platform details, and Python version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/env.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
twitch-dl env [OPTIONS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Output of twitch-dl env on Windows
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the output of the 'twitch-dl env' command when executed on a Windows system. It shows the twitch-dl version, Windows platform details, and Python version information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/commands/env.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
twitch-dl 1.21.0
Platform: Windows-10-10.0.19041-SP0
Python 3.9.4 (tags/v3.9.4:1f2e308, Apr 6 2021, 13:40:21) [MSC v.1928 64 bit (AMD64)]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Shell Completion for twitch-dl in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Add this line to ~/.bashrc to enable shell completion for twitch-dl in Bash.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/shell_completion.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
eval "$(_TWITCH_DL_COMPLETE=bash_source twitch-dl)"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Shell Completion for twitch-dl in Fish
DESCRIPTION: Add this line to ~/.config/fish/completions/twitch-dl.fish to enable shell completion for twitch-dl in Fish.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/shell_completion.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: fish
CODE:
```
_TWITCH_DL_COMPLETE=fish_source twitch-dl | source
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Shell Completion for twitch-dl in Zsh
DESCRIPTION: Add this line to ~/.zshrc to enable shell completion for twitch-dl in Zsh.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/shell_completion.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: zsh
CODE:
```
eval "$(_TWITCH_DL_COMPLETE=zsh_source twitch-dl)"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking FFmpeg Version in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command checks if FFmpeg is installed and available on the system by printing its version information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ffmpeg -version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample FFmpeg Version Output in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example of the output when running the FFmpeg version command, displaying the version number and build information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ffmpeg version 4.3.2-0+deb11u2 Copyright (c) 2000-2021 the FFmpeg developers
built with gcc 10 (Debian 10.2.1-6)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running twitch-dl Standalone Archive with Python in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to run the twitch-dl standalone archive by passing it to Python and displaying the help information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python3 twitch-dl.1.13.0.pyz --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making twitch-dl Standalone Archive Executable in Bash
DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to make the twitch-dl standalone archive executable and run it directly on Linux systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/installation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod +x twitch-dl.1.13.0.pyz
./twitch-dl.1.13.0.pyz --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GPL Source File Copyright Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: A template for the copyright and license notice that should be included at the beginning of each source file in a GPL-licensed program. This text explains the program's license terms, including redistribution rights and warranty disclaimers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/license.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GPL Terminal Program Interactive Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: A shorter notice template for terminal programs that should be displayed when starting in interactive mode. It briefly informs users about the warranty disclaimer and redistribution conditions, with commands for viewing license details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ihabunek/twitch-dl/blob/master/docs/license.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<program>  Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>
This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.
```
